Work.title: Clinical Research Associate, CTC AB
Work.Description: My role was to be the main point of contact between clients, clinics and other parties participating in the study

Work.title: Project Assistant, PPD Scandinavia AB
Work.Description: I mainly provided administrative support to the Clinical Research Associates, maintaining the clinical trial master file and distributing study material to the clinics.

Work.title: Logistics Controller, Coop Sverige AB
Work.Description: Worked with collecting and organizing orders for grocery store chains.

Education.title: Fullstackutvecklare .NET, Chas Academy
Education.Description: A 2 year programme with C# and the Microsoft .NET plattform as a vantage point. From there the students learn to work with databases, serverside programming, frontend and backend development.

Education.title: M.SC in Biomedicine, Karolinska Institute
Education.Description: The programme was focused on understanding disease mechanisms at a molecular level, particularly for the most common and widespread diseases, with the aim of developing future methods for the diagnosis and treatment of these diseases.

Other.title: Boardmember, Karolinska Institutet Biomedicine Alumni Association (KIBAA)
Other.Description: I was among a group of students that started Karolinska Institutet Biomedicine Alumni Association (KIBAA). Our main goal was to improve the connection between the university and it's alumni of the Biomedicine programs. This was accomplished through organizing an annual homecoming dinner along with networking events

Other.title: Project Manager, The Future Network
Other.Description: A student-driven, 1-year Mentorship program at Karolinska Institute aimed at creating a platform were chosen students can meet and interact with mentors that are active in the academia and life science industry. My role as the project leader was to organize the program in terms of choosing students among the applicants, finding mentors active in the life science industry and planning the meetings. Last yearâ€™s program started in February with 23 mentor-mentee couples (46 participants).
